description: Firefox is changing too fast and getting to handsy as browsers do these days, Librewolf preserves base functionality but with extra hardening I can't be asked to do myself.
summary: Ever since I moved to Linux, I swore by LibreWolf

description: Carrying the flag that Mozilla dropped
does what it needs
The browser itself is great. But I've had a lot of problems with flatpak or snap browsers. It'd be better if it was packaged into debs/rpms etc because those generally run better for web browsers.
A lot of things are set to a bad default and can't be changed. Why?

First I'll start by saying I'm a linux noob. I gave it 3 stars because I've used it before when I downloaded the app image so I know it's a good browser but I've distro hopped a few times trying things out. Unfortunately installing it through the software store the browser opens rather slowly and then simply isn't responsive.
A firefox fork tweaked with telemetry disable by default
I installed this after trying just about every other browser available for Linux and I'm glad to say that it is just what I need. Great job!

An updated no-telemetry firefox, probably the easiest way to get a better firefox. It's usable and do everything you expect out of the box.
From a privacy standpoint, it's not the most you can get with firefox, another easy way is the arkenfox user.js project. If you compare both, arkenfox is more secure and as usable. 
Where librewolf really fails is against fingerprinting, its fingerprint is really peculiar and it's easy to figure out that you are using librewolf or at least something really weird that makes you unique.
It's a great candidate if you separate different parts of your life in different browsers.
Not worth it. Instead, I modified firefox' s "about:config" into hardened firefox and called it FireWolf.
This is a pretty good browser.
There seems to be no way to configure permission for external storage.

I am a longtime Firefox user. I only discovered LibreWolf last night. Love the project and the product so far. Key feature for me is the privacy expertise of the platform packaged into a product I can use pretty much out of the box:
* I left most of the settings as is
* I only imported bookmarks and setup couple extra extensions

Now I can run double browser setup with Firefox-based browsers only. 

I wanted to show the maintainers some love and support with 5 stars. This is not meant to be a comprehensive review.
aadwada dwad asf
If it gets a Privacy on/off button, it will be the next firefox in terms of popularity. Right now is the best privacy browser for us linux users.

Love this browser. Firefox without the privacy issues.
Only things I would like to see if Firefox Sync support, or alternatively a LibreWolf Android browser - that is downloaded and updated directly from LibreWolf's website (similar to Telegram).

Good work to the devs!

Pros:
- Firefox without telemetry
- Privacy OK

Cons:
- Sandboxed with all its drawbacks (for ex: can´t open specific URLs to trigger other applications)
summary: Firefox without telemetry, but feels unpolished

description: I've taken to using Librewolf instead of Firefox because it offers better privacy and it won't get converted into a snap by Canonical. I still keep Firefox around as a fallback, though.
Clean and minimal UI with ideal privacy defaults right out of the box.
summary: Great alternative to IceCat and Brave

description: I love the fact it removes all telemetry and it also makes a great effort to keep your privacy a priority, it may be a little bit difficult to adapt to things like all website data being deleted upon closing the browser, yet when you get used to it, you really learn to love its way to surf the web
I love this Firefox fork the best

I remove all file access from this app like downloads, videos, pictures and music but i can still download anything into any file and upload any file and also move any file. Why? Is this a major bruh moment in flatpak or LibreWolf? I checked Fedora flatpak firefox and the file access system works great so please fix this asap if you are possible.
its the best looking browser with privacy features
Fingerprinting under coveryourtracks.eff.org is not prevented like in tor...please fix.
Better then Firefox.
funciona out the box, solo le agregas un gestor de contraseñas y si queres NoScript y ya tenes un navegador muy seguro y privado
that being auto update on Linux
This is what FireFox should've been in the first place, no cringe and good privacy.

Praktisch gleichwertig zum Firefox mit mehr Schwerpunkt auf Privatsphäre.	Empfehlenswert auch als Alternative zu Chrome und Opera oder als unabhängiger Zweitbrowser für Projekte die besser einen extra Browser bräuchten.

In search for an alternative to Firefox 91 on wayland, which produces annoying freezes regularly even in software mode, i have found this gem of a more solid fork with many nice features. The LibreWolf version is 91.0.1 and it runs more stable than the FF versions 91.0.1-2 but still freezes sometimes.
In comparison tests i found out, that LibreWolf uses older versions of LLVM and mesa driver, which seem to help a bit in terms of stability alongside with further measurements by the LibreWolf Community. WebGL is deactivated though but suprisingly web videos play faster and more responsive.
I am using FF for many years now, but something seems to be messed up in the mozilla FF headquarters lately. Hopefully they manage to solve their issues.
summary: Very fast and responsive al Hamdu li Llah

description: Librewolf is a really amazing browser. It basically is a hardened Firefox without the telemetry in Firefox (which is opt out). But still it's great to have a browser that is configured to be more secure out of the box, so you don't have to do the hardening yourself.
Es Firefox, todo lo bueno de él. Sumando una configuración de privacidad bastante equilibrada. Está muy bien.
summary: Firefox con una buena configuración de privacidad

description: pero no puedo cambiar idioma, sale error de conexión plis, lo demás bien

Me encanto LibreWolf es rapido, eficaz y seguro. Sin embargo al tener un computador de bajos recursos, con poca ram, me parece excesivo lo que consume, incluso mas que Firefox con varias extenciones instaladas. No es usable teniendo otros programas abiertos pues el sistema en general queda demasiado lento.
summary: Me gusta, pero consume mucha ram

description: Un navegador muy versatil, basado en firefox y sin nada que envidar a aquellos basados en chromium. Lo que para mi lo hace de lo mejor son sus "prebuild features" de privacidad y seguridad, que hacen que sea mas comodo navegar por la web, otorgando una capa mas de privacidad y haciendo que no tengas que preocuparte tanto por la recoleccion de datos que muchas compañias hacen sobre sus usuarios.
Использую как второй браузер. Быстро работает, да еще и на wayland. Однако, некоторые картинки выглядят как каша из случайных пикселей
При запуске приложения появляится только черный экран
Просто безупречно работает. Спасибо

Все работает. 
P.s. addon User-Agent in YouTube make artefakts:(
Очень хорошо, но денег не дам
